name: flow_cytometry_assay
description: Template based on the expectactions from the FlowRepository (flowrepository.org) and the Minimum Information about Flow Cytometry Experiments (MIFlowCyt) developed by the International Society for Advancement of Cytometry (ISAC). More details can be found at https://doi.org/10.25504/FAIRsharing.kcnjj2. The LinkML Schema and template was developed by the Michigan State University Superfund Research Center Data Management and Analysis Core.

WhitespaceMinimizedString.name: WhitespaceMinimizedString
WhitespaceMinimizedString.description: A string that has all whitespace trimmed off of beginning and end, and all internal whitespace segments reduced to single spaces. Whitespace includes #x9 (tab), #xA (linefeed), and #xD (carriage return).

Provenance.name: Provenance
Provenance.description: A field containing a DataHarmonizer versioning marker. It is issued by DataHarmonizer when validation is applied to a given row of data.

float.name: float
float.description: A real number that conforms to the xsd:float specification

double.name: double
double.description: A real number that conforms to the xsd:double specification

decimal.name: decimal
decimal.description: A real number with arbitrary precision that conforms to the xsd:decimal specification

time.name: time
time.description: A time object represents a (local) time of day, independent of any particular day
notes: URI is dateTime because OWL reasoners do not work with straight date or time

date.name: date
date.description: a date (year, month and day) in an idealized calendar
notes: URI is dateTime because OWL reasoners don't work with straight date or time

datetime.name: datetime
datetime.description: The combination of a date and time

date_or_datetime.name: date_or_datetime
date_or_datetime.description: Either a date or a datetime

curie.name: curie
comments: in RDF serializations this MUST be expanded to a URI
in non-RDF serializations MAY be serialized as the compact representation

uri.name: uri
comments: in RDF serializations a slot with range of uri is treated as a literal or type xsd:anyURI unless it is an identifier or a reference to an identifier, in which case it is translated directly to a node

objectidentifier.name: objectidentifier
objectidentifier.description: A URI or CURIE that represents an object in the model.
comments: Used for inheritence and type checking

nodeidentifier.name: nodeidentifier
nodeidentifier.description: A URI, CURIE or BNODE that represents a node in a model.

The instrument has not been altered.text: The instrument has not been altered

flow_experiment_identifier.name: flow_experiment_identifier
flow_experiment_identifier.description: This is a unique ID assigned by the user to represent each individual record in this flow cytometry experiment.
flow_experiment_identifier.title: Flow_experiment_ID

investigation_identifier.name: investigation_identifier
investigation_identifier.description: The identifier for this investigation collected using the "investigation" template. This is used to match the flow cytometry experiment to an investigation.
investigation_identifier.title: Investigation_ID

study_identifier.name: study_identifier
study_identifier.description: The identifier for this study collected using the template appropriate for your study design (e.g., MIATE for animal experiments). This is used to match the flow cytometry experiment to a study.
study_identifier.title: Study_ID

sample_identifier.name: sample_identifier
sample_identifier.description: The identifier for this study collected using the template appropriate for your study design (e.g., MIATE for animal experiments). This is used to match the sample source to the data.
sample_identifier.title: Sample_ID

purpose.name: purpose
purpose.description: A brief description of the goal of the experiment. This should include the rationale and hypothesis.
purpose.title: purpose
comments: Test the hypothesis that CD5+ innate-like B Cells (ILBs) are sensitive to AHR-mediated immunotoxicity.

keywords.name: keywords
keywords.description: The keywords should include terms from an appropriate vocabulary (e.g. MeSH) to describe the experiment. Each keyword should be seperated by a ";" with not spaces.
keywords.title: keywords

experimentVariables.name: experimentVariables
experimentVariables.description: Variables are attribute(s) that differ between samples within an experiment due to pre-existing differences in sample states or due to experimental manipulation of the samples.
experimentVariables.title: experimentVariables

primaryContact.name: primaryContact
primaryContact.description: The individual who is the primary contact for this experiment (last name,first name).
primaryContact.title: primaryContact

date.name: date
date.description: The date or time period during which the investigation was performed (i.e., from collecting and treating samples to performing data analysis) shall be stated.
date.title: date

conclusions.name: conclusions
conclusions.description: A brief summary of the interpretation of the results or outcome of the experiment shall be provided if available.
conclusions.title: conclusions
comments: Levels of AHR-mediated suppression of the IgM response from individual donors strongly correlated with the percentage of the B cell pool that was CD5+, suggesting that CD5+ B cells are more sensitive to AHR-mediated impairment.

qualityControlMeasures.name: qualityControlMeasures
qualityControlMeasures.description: A description of the quality control measures used such as replicates, calibrations, control assays, etc. shall be provided. If another experiment was performed for the purposes of establishing quality control standards, that experiment may be referenced.
qualityControlMeasures.title: qualityControlMeasures

flow_cytometry_protocol.name: flow_cytometry_protocol
flow_cytometry_protocol.description: A brief description of the flow cytometry protocol
flow_cytometry_protocol.title: flow_cytometry_protocol
comments: Cells were processed using a BD FACSCanto II using FACS Diva software (BD Bioscience) and analyzed using FloJo (Version 10, Treestar Software, Ashland OR).

flow_cytometry_protocol_DOI.name: flow_cytometry_protocol_DOI
flow_cytometry_protocol_DOI.description: A DOI to a version controlled protocol, preferably available on a repository such as protocols.io
flow_cytometry_protocol_DOI.title: flow_cytometry_protocol_DOI

staining_protocol.name: staining_protocol
staining_protocol.description: A brief description of the flow cytometry protocol
staining_protocol.title: staining_protocol

staining_protocol_DOI.name: staining_protocol_DOI
staining_protocol_DOI.description: A DOI to a version controlled protocol, preferably available on a repository such as protocols.io
staining_protocol_DOI.title: staining_protocol_DOI

characteristicsBeingMeasured.name: characteristicsBeingMeasured
characteristicsBeingMeasured.description: The relative amount of molecules, properties, or processes being evaluated (e.g., CD25, apoptosis, membrane permeability, cell viability, oxidative burst). The characteristic(s) being measured shall be provided whenever there is ambiguity about the analyte being measured, such as when sample processing affects detection of the analyte (e.g., propidium iodide example in Table 1). The optical detector (e.g., FL1) or parameter (e.g., FL1-H) used primarily for this measurement shall be indicated.
characteristicsBeingMeasured.title: characteristicsBeingMeasured

analyte.name: analyte
analyte.description: What plays the role of the analyte? Which substance or chemical constituent is the subject of interest of the analytical procedure, what target is specifically bound by the analyte detector (e.g., CD25)?
analyte.title: analyte

analyteDetector.name: analyteDetector
analyteDetector.description: What plays the role of analyte detector? Which component of the fluorescence reagent specifically binds to the analyte to make it detectable (e.g., anti-CD25 antibody)?
analyteDetector.title: analyteDetector

analyteReporter.name: analyteReporter
analyteReporter.description: (Fluorochrome) What plays the role of analyte reporter? Which component of the fluorescence reagent reports the presents of the analyte to the flow cytometer? What substance (label) is used to generate the measured signal (e.g., FITC)?
analyteReporter.title: analyteReporter

cloneNameOrNumber.name: cloneNameOrNumber
cloneNameOrNumber.description: If the probe is a monoclonal antibody, the clone name or number shall be provided.
cloneNameOrNumber.title: cloneNameOrNumber

reagentManufacturerName.name: reagentManufacturerName
reagentManufacturerName.description: The reagent manufacturer shall be specified (e.g., MIFlowCyt Reagent Inc.).
reagentManufacturerName.title: reagentManufacturerName

reagentCatalogueNumber.name: reagentCatalogueNumber
reagentCatalogueNumber.description: The reagent catalogue number shall be specified.
reagentCatalogueNumber.title: reagentCatalogueNumber

other_fluorescence_reagent.name: other_fluorescence_reagent
other_fluorescence_reagent.description: When secondary antibodies are used, the primary analyte (the analyte bound by the primary antibody) and the reporter component of the secondary antibody (the reporter that generates the measured signal) shall be clearly specified as described in 2.4.2, 2.4.3, and 2.4.4. If relevant, the primary and secondary antibodies shall be described individually (e.g., in the case that the use of a secondary antibody significantly impacts the interpretation of results because of nonspecific fluorescence, etc.). The description should also contain other relevant details which may include lot number, concentration, label incorporation method, separation technique, antibody staining procedures, and wash steps.
other_fluorescence_reagent.title: other_fluorescence_reagent

analysis_protocol.name: analysis_protocol
analysis_protocol.description: A brief description of the flow cytometry protocol
analysis_protocol.title: analysis_protocol
comments: Positive gates were drawn using unstained and day 0 controls.

analysis_protocol_DOI.name: analysis_protocol_DOI
analysis_protocol_DOI.description: A DOI to a version controlled protocol, preferably available on a repository such as protocols.io
analysis_protocol_DOI.title: analysis_protocol_DOI

listModeDataFile.name: listModeDataFile
listModeDataFile.description: The list-mode data files (e.g., FCS files [18]) shall be provided directly or details on how they may be requested shall be stated.
listModeDataFile.title: listModeDataFile

TransformationPurpose.name: TransformationPurpose
TransformationPurpose.description:
The purpose of each performed transformation shall be specified (e.g.,
data visualization, background correction, statistical analysis, quantitative
flow cytometry, etc.).
TransformationPurpose.title: TransformationPurpose

TransformationDescription.name: TransformationDescription
TransformationDescription.description:
Either the exact mathematical formulas/algorithms of each data
transformation shall be supplied using an open and freely available
specification, or a description of each transformation shall be provided.
TransformationDescription.title: TransformationDescription

GateDescription.name: GateDescription
GateDescription.description:
The subpopulation identified by the gate shall be briefly described (e.g.,
“IL-4 producing helper T cells of the CD3+CD4+ phenotype”).
GateDescription.title: GateDescription

Gate Statistics.name: Gate Statistics
Gate Statistics.description:
Percentage of events within the gate shall be provided specifically stating
the denominator. The denominator shall be either the total population of events (e.g., percentage of lymphocytes based on the total number of
events) or another gate (e.g., percentage of CD4+ lymphocytes based on
all lymphocytes). When the denominator is another gate, this shall also be
exactly specified in recursive fashion so that the gating strategy can be
followed up to the original data set. The denominator may not necessarily
be a containing (superset) population for some statistics (e.g., the donor /
host blood cell ratio).
Gate Statistics.title: Gate Statistics

GateBoundaries.name: GateBoundaries
GateBoundaries.description:
Either the exact mathematical descriptions of each gate boundary shall be
provided using an open and freely available specification, or this
information shall be provided in the form of images.
GateBoundaries.title: GateBoundaries

flowCellType.name: flowCellType
flowCellType.description: The flow cell type (e.g., stream-in-air, cuvette) including the material shall be provided.
flowCellType.title: flowCellType

other_flow_cell.name: other_flow_cell
other_flow_cell.description: Other relevant flow cell details should be provided and may include flow cell manufacturer name (e.g., MIFlowCyt Optics, Inc.) and model number (e.g., PRO-CFC-75), flow cell outside shape (e.g., rectangular with an attached sphere, spherical, square) and dimensions, flow channel shape (e.g., rectangular, circular, triangular) and dimensions, sheath flow velocity (e.g., 10 l/s), sheath flow pump type (e.g., gas pressure, vacuum, gear), sample flow velocity (e.g., 7.5 l/s) and sample flow pump (e.g., gas pressure, syringe).
other_flow_cell.title: other_flow_cell

manufacturer.name: manufacturer
manufacturer.description: The instrument manufacturer shall be specified by stating its name (e.g., MIFlowCyt Cytometry Systems, Inc.). A URL pointing to manufacturer web pages may also be provided.
manufacturer.title: manufacturer

model.name: model
model.description: The instrument model shall be specified (e.g., CytMeter Elite-2000). It may include the instrument serial number.
model.title: model

configurationAndSettings.name: configurationAndSettings
configurationAndSettings.description: The system and its configurations have significant impact on experimental results and as such the following shall be provided
configurationAndSettings.title: configurationAndSettings
comments: The instrument has not been altered

other_instrument.name: other_instrument
other_instrument.description: Additional relevant instrument details should be provided and may include machine-specific information such as information about automated agitation, temperature control, controlled volume dispensing, sampling from microtiter plates, auto-boost, auto-flush, etc. Other custom settings shall be provided if relevant and may include setting name, description, and value.
other_instrument.title: other_instrument

type.name: type
type.description: The type of the light source shall be provided (e.g., laser, diode laser, xenon lamp).
type.title: type

excitatoryWavelength.name: excitatoryWavelength
excitatoryWavelength.description: The excitatory wavelength shall be provided (e.g., 488nm, 633 nm).
excitatoryWavelength.title: excitatoryWavelength

powerAtExcitatoryWavelength.name: powerAtExcitatoryWavelength
powerAtExcitatoryWavelength.description: The power of the light source shall be provided (e.g., 180 mW, 50 mW). If possible, this should be measured at the intersection of the light source beam with particles; see also 3.3.3.
powerAtExcitatoryWavelength.title: powerAtExcitatoryWavelength

polarization.name: polarization
polarization.description: Polarization shall be specified (e.g., linear, >100:1, in the direction of the sample flow). If possible, this should be specified at the intersection of the light source beam and particles; see also 3.3.3.
polarization.title: polarization

beam.name: beam
beam.description: Light source beam dimensions and geometry shall be specified at the flow cell or at the intersection of the beam with particles (e.g., elliptical 22 x 66 Î¼m).
beam.title: beam

other_light_source_instrument.name: other_light_source_instrument
other_light_source_instrument.description: Additional relevant light source details should be provided and may include light source manufacturer name (e.g., MIFlowCyt Lasers, Inc.), light source model name (e.g., 302C Krypton-Ion Laser), light source part number (e.g., I-326), noise (e.g., <1%), pointing and power stability (e.g., <1% over 1 hour), etc.
other_light_source_instrument.title: other_light_source_instrument

name.name: name
name.description: The optical detector name (e.g., FSC, SSC, FL1, FL2, FL3, FL4, etc.) shall be specified.
name.title: name

type_optical_detector.name: type_optical_detector
type_optical_detector.description: The type of the optical detector shall be provided (e.g., photodiode, photomultiplier tube).
type_optical_detector.title: type_optical_detector

voltage.name: voltage
voltage.description: The optical detector voltage shall be specified (e.g., 300V, 700V).
voltage.title: voltage

amplificationType.name: amplificationType
amplificationType.description: The optical detector amplification type shall be specified (e.g., linear, log).  Additional details including the actual amplifier profile may be provided.
amplificationType.title: amplificationType

amplificationFactor.name: amplificationFactor
amplificationFactor.description: For log amplification, the number of decades shall be provided (e.g., 4 decades). For a linear amplification, the linear gain shall be provided (e.g., linear gain of 2.0).
amplificationFactor.title: amplificationFactor

other_optical_detector.name: other_optical_detector
other_optical_detector.description: Additional relevant optical detector details should be provided and may include the optical detector manufacturer name and model number (e.g., MIFlowCyt Photonics Inc., PMT #R9220), minimal, maximal, and peak wavelength sensitivity (e.g., 185 nm, 900 nm, and 650 nm), the internal gain (e.g., 107), or the rise time (e.g., 2.2ns).
other_optical_detector.title: other_optical_detector

type_optical_filter.name: type_optical_filter
type_optical_filter.description: The optical filter type shall be specified.
type_optical_filter.title: type_optical_filter

transmittedWavelengths.name: transmittedWavelengths
transmittedWavelengths.description: Light wavelengths transmitted by the filter shall be specified (e.g., 488/25 nm, >670 nm, <620 nm).
transmittedWavelengths.title: transmittedWavelengths

installationDate.name: installationDate
installationDate.description: As optical filters of all types are subject to degradation, filter performance needs to be monitored at intervals to verify continued performance at an acceptable level [19]. The optical filter installation date shall be specified (e.g., January 15, 2007).
installationDate.title: installationDate

other_optical_filter.name: other_optical_filter
other_optical_filter.description: Other relevant optical filter details should be provided.
other_optical_filter.title: other_optical_filter

flow_experiment_identifier.name: flow_experiment_identifier
flow_experiment_identifier.description: This is a unique ID assigned by the user to represent each individual record in this flow cytometry experiment.
flow_experiment_identifier.title: Flow_experiment_ID

investigation_identifier.name: investigation_identifier
investigation_identifier.description: The identifier for this investigation collected using the "investigation" template. This is used to match the flow cytometry experiment to an investigation.
investigation_identifier.title: Investigation_ID

study_identifier.name: study_identifier
study_identifier.description: The identifier for this study collected using the template appropriate for your study design (e.g., MIATE for animal experiments). This is used to match the flow cytometry experiment to a study.
study_identifier.title: Study_ID

sample_identifier.name: sample_identifier
sample_identifier.description: The identifier for this study collected using the template appropriate for your study design (e.g., MIATE for animal experiments). This is used to match the sample source to the data.
sample_identifier.title: Sample_ID

purpose.name: purpose
purpose.description: A brief description of the goal of the experiment. This should include the rationale and hypothesis.
purpose.title: purpose

keywords.name: keywords
keywords.description: The keywords should include terms from an appropriate vocabulary (e.g. MeSH) to describe the experiment. Each keyword should be seperated by a ";" with not spaces.
keywords.title: keywords

experimentVariables.name: experimentVariables
experimentVariables.description: Variables are attribute(s) that differ between samples within an experiment due to pre-existing differences in sample states or due to experimental manipulation of the samples.
experimentVariables.title: experimentVariables

primaryContact.name: primaryContact
primaryContact.description: The individual who is the primary contact for this experiment (last name,first name).
primaryContact.title: primaryContact

date.name: date
date.description: The date or time period during which the investigation was performed (i.e., from collecting and treating samples to performing data analysis) shall be stated.
date.title: date

conclusions.name: conclusions
conclusions.description: A brief summary of the interpretation of the results or outcome of the experiment shall be provided if available.
conclusions.title: conclusions

qualityControlMeasures.name: qualityControlMeasures
qualityControlMeasures.description: A description of the quality control measures used such as replicates, calibrations, control assays, etc. shall be provided. If another experiment was performed for the purposes of establishing quality control standards, that experiment may be referenced.
qualityControlMeasures.title: qualityControlMeasures

flow_cytometry_protocol.title: flow_cytometry_protocol

amplificationFactor.title: amplificationFactor

other_optical_detector.name: other_optical_detector
other_optical_detector.description: Additional relevant optical detector details should be provided and may include the optical detector manufacturer name and model number (e.g., MIFlowCyt Photonics Inc., PMT #R9220), minimal, maximal, and peak wavelength sensitivity (e.g., 185 nm, 900 nm, and 650 nm), the internal gain (e.g., 107), or the rise time (e.g., 2.2ns).
other_optical_detector.title: other_optical_detector

type_optical_filter.name: type_optical_filter
type_optical_filter.description: The optical filter type shall be specified.
type_optical_filter.title: type_optical_filter

transmittedWavelengths.name: transmittedWavelengths
transmittedWavelengths.description: Light wavelengths transmitted by the filter shall be specified (e.g., 488/25 nm, >670 nm, <620 nm).
transmittedWavelengths.title: transmittedWavelengths

installationDate.name: installationDate
installationDate.description: As optical filters of all types are subject to degradation, filter performance needs to be monitored at intervals to verify continued performance at an acceptable level [19]. The optical filter installation date shall be specified (e.g., January 15, 2007).
installationDate.title: installationDate

other_optical_filter.name: other_optical_filter
other_optical_filter.description: Other relevant optical filter details should be provided.
other_optical_filter.title: other_optical_filter
